Organized activities at Hitzman Park suspended through Sunday, Mar. 10. PUBLIC INFORMATION: March 6, 2024 MEDIA CONTACT: Jason Wheeler 850-435-1623 jwheeler @cityofpensacola.com Organized Activities at Hitzman-Optimist Park Canceled for Remainder of the Week The City of Pensacola announces all organized activities at Hitzman-Optimist Park have been canceled for the remainder of the week following the tragic death of a child in the park‚Äôs parking lot Tuesday evening. ‚ÄúOur hearts go out to this child‚Äôs family, as well as to the Hitzman Park and Scenic Heights Elementary community,‚Äù says Pensacola Mayor D.C. Reeves. ‚ÄúAs a father, I cannot begin to fathom what this family is going through. We will continue to embrace all those affected by this tragedy in our city.‚Äù While organized activities at the park at 3221 Langley Avenue have been suspended through Sunday, the park remains open to the public. For more information or general questions,¬†email pio@cityofpensacola.com .¬†To stay informed about what's happening with City of Pensacola government, sign up for email or text notifications through Notify Me or follow @CityofPensacola on social media. Connect with our team Owner, CEO, President Farina Headrick Farina Headrick has headed the DGA family since 2002 when she took over the day to day operations after Ed Headrick, the Father of Disc Golf, passed away. Farina is passionate about supporting the continued growth of the sport her husband founded in 1976. City to Unveil Vision Plan for Hollice T. Williams Park Tuesday, April 8 PUBLIC INFORMATION: April 3, 2025 MEDIA CONTACT: Travis Peterson 850-501-5262 travis@impactcampaigns.com City of Pensacola to Unveil Vision Plan for Hollice T. Williams Park Next Week Community Meeting: Tuesday, April 8 from 6-7:30 p.m. at the Cobb Community Center Following months of research and planning, thousands of data points collected, and dozens of stakeholder and community meetings, the design team tasked with reimagining Hollice T. Williams Park and Long Hollow Stormwater Pond will present their proposed Vision Plan for the 60-acre park on Tuesday, April 8, at 6 p.m. at the Cobb Community Center. Residents of the Eastside and Long Hollow neighborhoods, former residents of the area, and other community members are invited to attend the presentation, review the Vision Plan ‚Äî featuring a 15-foot, 3-dimensional model of the plan ‚Äî and share their feedback on its ideas. The Vision Plan marks a significant milestone in the design process. It lays out the basic framework for the park's design, including pathways and areas for gathering, recreation, and relaxation. With more community input, the Vision Plan will be updated to include more specific design elements such as landscaping, programming, playgrounds, or sports areas. The park design team has worked with community groups, park users, area neighborhoods, state and federal agency stakeholders, and former residents to ensure the community‚Äôs input is accurately reflected in the park design and expansion plans. Led by Pensacola native Katie Fox of Geosyntec Consultants , the team also includes renowned park designers Michael Van Valkenbergh Associates , and Pensacola-based landscape architects Jerry Pate Design . ‚ÄúThe Vision Plan lays the foundation for the future development of the entire Hollice T. Williams Park and Long Hollow Pond,‚Äù said Fox. ‚ÄúWe want to connect these two unique spaces to each other and the surrounding neighborhoods in a way that addresses stormwater concerns and creates a unique and safe space for neighbors and residents to gather, play, and relax ‚Äî while also commemorating the vibrant neighborhood that used to exist here,‚Äù she said. The park, located under the I-110 overpass, was once home to hundreds of African-American families, churches, and businesses. In order to construct the towering highway, the entire neighborhood was displaced, disrupting generations of history, culture, and economic advancement. Since 2004, improving the park has been discussed through numerous long-range neighborhood plans, but only recently has the city acquired funding to begin the development of the park ‚Äî thanks to several grants secured to address stormwater, water quality, walkability, and public safety issues in the area. A 2021 park design was created but was later shelved after Pensacola Mayor D.C. Reeves received feedback from Harvard University‚Äôs Mayors Institute for City Design that the plan lacked enough community feedback and connectivity. The city then hired a new consultant group to solicit greater community input in their process, and the Vision Plan is the initial result of that effort. Further design work will continue throughout the year as the park design team translates the Vision Plan elements into engineering and construction drawings for the first phases of the park construction. For those who cannot attend the Tuesday night presentation, the design team and the Vision Plan model will also host an Open House on Wednesday, April 9, from 8:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. at the Cobb Center gymnasium. More information on the project can be found at www.HTWpensacola.com . For more information or general questions,¬†email pio@cityofpensacola.com .¬†To stay informed about what's happening with City of Pensacola government, sign up for email or text notifications through Notify Me or follow @CityofPensacola on social media. Nearby courses Nearby stores Frequently asked questions How do I get to Hitzman Optimist? You can get directions to Hitzman Optimist by clicking Get Directions , which will open your device's map application with the disc golf course location. The disc golf course is located at 30.48822, -87.181435 in Pensacola, Florida . Do I need to pay to play disc golf at Hitzman Optimist? Hitzman Optimist is free to play! Just show up and enjoy the disc golf course. What is the difficulty and length of Hitzman Optimist? Hitzman Optimist has 9 disc golf holes and has a difficulty rating of " Moderate " . The typical disc golf round at Hitzman Optimist takes about 1 hour and covers approximately 0.8 miles ( 1.3 km). How highly rated is Hitzman Optimist by the disc golf community? Hitzman Optimist has an average rating of 4.2 out of 5 stars based on 1029 community reviews . This is considered a very good course rating by the disc golf community. What amenities are available at Hitzman Optimist? Hitzman Optimist offers the following amenities: 9 disc golf holes, restrooms, cart-friendly paths, pet-friendly areas . When is the best time to play at Hitzman Optimist? Upgrade to UDisc Pro to see detailed course traffic patterns and find the best times to play disc golf here. How can I track my disc golf round at Hitzman Optimist? You can track your disc golf round using the UDisc mobile app. If on your phone, click the "Start a Round" button at the bottom of this page to begin navigating Hitzman Optimist and tracking your disc golf round. The app provides GPS-enabled disc golf hole maps, scorekeeping, and stats tracking. Upgrade to UDisc Pro for advanced features like detailed statistics and course traffic information. Hitzman-Optimist Park in Northeast Pensacola Skip to main content Kick off fall with savings! $35 app fees through September 30th. (850) 473-3983 Owner Login Tenant Login Apply For A Rental Home Property Management Property Management Pricing Available Rentals Homes for Rent Register Online Moving to Pensacola Military Housing Rental Criteria Owners Owner Resources Owner Portal Owner FAQs Tenants Tenant Resources Maintenance Requests Maintenance Tips and Troubleshooting Tenant FAQs Renew Lease Real Estate Services Buyers Sellers Investors Search For Homes Instant Valuation Vendors Vendor Resources Vendor Portal About Us Our Company Testimonials Contact Blog All Categories Investors Renting Community MENU (850) 473-3983 Owner Login Tenant Login Home Property Management Property Management Pricing Available Rentals Homes for Rent Register Online Moving to Pensacola Military Housing Rental Criteria Owners Owner Resources Owner Portal Owner FAQs Tenants Tenant Resources Maintenance Requests Maintenance Tips and Troubleshooting Tenant FAQs Renew Lease Real Estate Services Buyers Sellers Investors Search For Homes Instant Valuation Vendors Vendor Resources Vendor Portal About Us Our Company Testimonials Contact Blog All Categories Investors Renting Community Youtube Instagram Facebook Tiktok Property Management Blog Hitzman-Optimist Park in Northeast Pensacola By Nicole St. Aubin Wednesday, August 16, 2023 Looking for a nice, shaded park with restrooms in central Pensacola? Hitzman Optimist is the park for you. More commonly referred to by locals as ‚ÄúHitzman‚Äù or ‚ÄúOptimist Park‚Äù, Hitzman-Optimist Park located at 3221 Langley Ave in Pensacola, Florida 32504. Optimist Park received an extensive makeover in 2019 and is now one of our favorite parks in Pensacola. ¬†The new inclusive design was created for people of all ages and abilities with rubber flooring on the playground and no sand to worry about (mom‚Äôs love this!). ¬†The playground is large with several pieces of equipment to accommodate kids of all ages. Families can enjoy the shaded benches located throughout the park, a covered pavilion for picnics or birthday parties and a fenced in area for your dogs to roam and there‚Äôs plenty of parking. Aside from the children‚Äôs playground, you‚Äôll also find a variety of entertainment including: Nine-disc golf course Soccer fields Baseball and softball fields Paved walking trail Small and large dog park You‚Äôll often find events hosted as Optimistic Park, from birthday parties and food truck festivals to Christmas tree sales to fund youth programs. ¬†For information about events that may be going on at the park, check out their Facebook page or our local news outlets. Check out some of our other favorite local Pensacola area parks: Innerarity Point Park Benny Russell Park in Pace Carpenter‚Äôs Park in Milton Blake Doyle Skate Park Pensacola Public Pools Pensacola area Splash Pads Share Author Nicole St. Aubin Operations Director, Broker Nicole St. Aubin joined the Realty Masters team in 2004. She is a licensed Florida Real Estate Broker and is the Director of Operations at Realty Masters. Nicole graduated from University of West Florida in 2007 with a BS in
							Communication Arts. She has continued her education in the real estate and property management industry, earning several certifications and designations including the Military Relocation Professional, At Home With Diversity
							Certification, and Cert... Nicole St. Aubin joined the Realty Masters team in 2004. She is a licensed Florida Real Estate Broker and is the Director of Operations at Realty Masters. Nicole graduated from University of West Florida in 2007 with a BS in
							Communication Arts. She has continued her education in the real estate and property management industry, earning several certifications and designations including the Military Relocation Professional, At Home With Diversity
							Certification, and Certified Residential Specialist designation, which less than 1% of Realtors earn. As a Realtor for 17 years, she has experience in helping everyone, from first time homebuyers to seasoned investors selling their
							income-producing properties. With her expertise in both investment sales and rental properties, Nicole is seen to be a local industry expert in the Pensacola area rental market. She served 6 years on the Pensacola Association of Realtors Board of Directors and
							continues to be an active board member with the Pensacola Chapter of the National Association of Residential Property Managers. In addition to being chosen as one of InWeekly‚Äôs Rising Stars, Nicole has been featured in Florida Trend
							Magazine, the Pensacola News Journal, and WEAR TV. Nicole has a passion for community work and has also volunteered with several Pensacola area non-profits including Big Brothers Big Sisters, Guardian Ad Litem, Pensacola Young
							Professionals, and Make-a-Wish Foundation. As a nature enthusiast and workaholic, she loves photographing everything from houses to the sunrise. When she is not working, she is spending time with her husband and two young daughters. Nicole truly cares about providing safe,
							affordable, and fair housing for all in the Pensacola area.
